mil3.7.3:0.3: 3. Question on Striving for the Removal of Past Suffering
mil3.7.3:1.2: “Venerable Nāgasena, are you striving for the abandonment of past suffering?”
mil3.7.3:1.4: “Then, venerable sir, are you striving for the abandonment of future suffering?”
mil3.7.3:1.6: “Then, venerable sir, are you striving for the abandonment of present suffering?”
mil3.7.3:1.8: “If you are not striving for the abandonment of past suffering, nor for the abandonment of future suffering, nor for the abandonment of present suffering, then what are you striving for?”
mil3.7.3:1.10: “Your majesty, I am striving so that this suffering would cease and that no other suffering would arise.”
mil3.7.3:2.1: “Is there now, venerable Nāgasena, future suffering for you?”
mil3.7.3:6.1: Question on Striving for the Abandonment of Suffering third
